description: One pan, ten minutes prep and a mouthwatering dinner that's an all in one meal. These harissa vegetables, rice and chickpeas will quickly be your new low prep favorite!
keywords: one pan rice, spicy rice recipe
name: One Pan Harissa Vegetables, Rice and Chickpeas
recipeIngredient: 2 1/2 cups veggie broth (, low sodium if needed)
1 1/4 cups dairy free plain yogurt (, I use Silk brand almond milk yogurt)
1/2 cup chopped tri color sweet peppers (, or just red or yellow pepeprs)
2 tablespoons lemon juice (, plus optional thin lemon slices for garnish)
1 teaspoon salt (, adjust depending on sodium in broth)
1 1/2 cups cooked chickpeas (, rinsed and drained (about one 15 ounce can)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the rice, broth, yogurt, salsa, red onion, peppers, cilantro, lemon juice and salt in a 9 x 13 baking dish. Slowly mix the ingredients.
Add the beans and veggies and stir again.
Place the lemon slices on the top if using.
Bake 60-65 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is almost gone.
Let it settle for about 10 minutes, then serve. The remainder of the liquid will be absorbed as it settles, so donâ€™t overbake because the rice will get too dry.
I like my rice with a more al dente texture so you can always add more broth if needed and cook extra if you prefer your rice well done.
